result.markdown:
## Expected Return, Variance, and Standard Deviation of a Portfolio ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} set.seed(202) #| eval: true #| results: asis #| echo: false #| warning: false library(webexercises) w1 <- rnorm(1, mean = 0.40, sd = 0.1) w2 <- 1 - w1 r1 <- rnorm(1, mean = 0.11, sd = 0.07) r2 <- rnorm(1, mean = 0.09, sd = 0.07) sigma1 <- rnorm(1, mean = 0.29, sd = 0.03) sigma2 <- rnorm(1, mean = 0.19, sd = 0.02) correl <- rnorm(1, mean = 0.5, sd = 0.2) ``` ::: What is the **expected return** of a portfolio that invests **28.68**% in Asset 1 (expected return = **7.92**%) and the remaining **71.32**% in Asset 2 (expected return = **6.65**% )? ::: {.question-block}
✅ Expected return = w₁×r₁ + w₂×r₂ = **7.01**%.
::: What is the **variance** of the portfolio above, given correlation **0.21**, standard deviation of Asset 1 = **26.46**% and of Asset 2 = **18.71**%? ::: {.question-block}
✅ Variance = w₁²σ₁² + w₂²σ₂² + 2w₁w₂ρσ₁σ₂ = **2.79**.
::: What is the **standard deviation** of the portfolio above? ::: {.question-block}
✅ Standard deviation = √(variance) = **16.7**%.
:::
